content.description:
A tribute to Marcellus

1 Tum pater Anchises lacrimis ingressus obortis:

“O gnate, ingentem luctum ne quaere tuorum;

ostendent terris hunc tantum fata nec ultra

esse sinent. Nimium vobis Romana propago

5 visa potens, superi, propria haec si dona fuissent.

Quantos ille virum magnam Mavortis ad urbem

campus aget gemitus! vel quae, Tiberine, videbis

funera, cum tumulum praeterlabere recentem!

Nec puer Iliaca quisquam de gente Latinos

10 in tantum spe tollet avos, nec Romula quondam

ullo se tantum tellus iactabit alumno.

Heu pietas, heu prisca fides invictaque bello

dextera! Non illi se quisquam impune tulisset

obvius armato, seu cum pedes iret in hostem

15 seu spumantis equi foderet calcaribus armos.”
content.question: In line 3, the words ostendent terris hunc tantum fata are translated

choices.label: The fates merely show him the lands.
The fates will merely show him to the lands.
If only the fates showed him to the lands!
The fates will be shown to him only on the lands.

content.answer: The fates will merely show him to the lands.
